channel.title: Java errors
channel.description:
Hey guys, ive been out of RSPS's for a while and commin back for another blast after pure boredom. Just need a tad help with JAVA variables, now I've downloaded the latest JDK which is JDK 7u4. I am running on win7 64 bit and copied the tuts I've seen about but changing the variables to the latest version and my compiler and runserver is giving me this error when i open them.
'the system cannot find the path specified'
FIXED IT GUYS, SIMPLE AND STUPID ERROR, PUT JDK1.7.0.4 IN THE VARIABLES INSTEAD OF JDK1.7.0.04 SORRY FOR BEIN A BLIND FOOL

item.title: Java errors
item.dc:creator: @ZippZipp ZippZipp
item.description:
@ZippZipp wrote:

Hey guys, ive been out of RSPS’s for a while and commin back for another blast after pure boredom. Just need a tad help with JAVA variables, now I’ve downloaded the latest JDK which is JDK 7u4.

I am running on win7 64 bit and copied the tuts I’ve seen about but changing the variables to the latest version and my compiler and runserver is giving me this error when i open them.

'the system cannot find the path specified'

FIXED IT GUYS, SIMPLE AND STUPID ERROR, PUT JDK1.7.0.4 IN THE VARIABLES INSTEAD OF JDK1.7.0.04
SORRY FOR BEIN A BLIND FOOL
